definitions.definition: The act of appointing a person to hold an office or to have a position of trust
examples: His appointment as treasurer was deemed suitable.

definitions.definition: The state of being appointed to a service or office; an office to which one is appointed
Stipulation ; agreement ; the act of fixing by mutual agreement.
An arrangement between people to meet; an engagement .
examples: They made an appointment to meet at six.
I’m leaving work early because I have a doctor’s appointment .

definitions.definition: Decree ; direction; established order or constitution .
examples: to submit to the divine appointments

definitions.definition: The exercise of the power of designating (under a power of appointment ) a person to enjoy an estate or other specific property; also, the instrument by which the designation is made.
The assignment of a person by an official to perform a duty, such as a presidential appointment of a judge to a court.
An honorary part or exercise, as an oration, etc., at a public exhibition of a college.
The allowance paid to a public officer .

main_definition: The act of appointing a person to hold an office or to have a position of trust
secondary_definitions: The state of being appointed to a service or office; an office to which one is appointed
Stipulation ; agreement ; the act of fixing by mutual agreement.
An arrangement between people to meet; an engagement .
( religion ) Decree ; direction; established order or constitution .
( law ) The exercise of the power of designating (under a power of appointment ) a person to enjoy an estate or other specific property; also, the instrument by which the designation is made.
( government ) The assignment of a person by an official to perform a duty, such as a presidential appointment of a judge to a court.
( US ) An honorary part or exercise, as an oration, etc., at a public exhibition of a college.
( obsolete ) The allowance paid to a public officer .
